title: How to Make Hot Cross Buns

steps.headline: Bring the milk to a boil and melt the butter in it.
steps.description: Pour 1 ⁄4 cups (300 ml) plus 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of whole milk into a saucepan and turn the burner to medium. Heat the milk until it begins to boil and then turn off the burner. Add 3 1/2 tablespoons (50 g) of butter and swirl the milk so it melts the butter. Set the pan aside until the milk cools to room temperature.Did You Know? Hot cross buns are made with an enriched dough. Instead of making the dough with water, the dough gets flavor from milk, butter, and eggs.

steps.headline: Put bread flour, salt, sugar, and yeast into a large bowl.
steps.description: Place 4 cups (508 g) of bread flour into a large mixing bowl along with 1 teaspoon (5 g) of salt, 6 tablespoons (75 g) of granulated sugar, and 1 1/4-ounce (7 g) package of instant (fast-action) yeast. Use your hand to make a well in the center of the bowl. There's no need to mix the dry ingredients at this point. It's important to put the salt and yeast on separate sides of the bowl. The salt will kill the yeast if they come into direct contact.

steps.headline: Pour the milk mixture and 1 beaten egg into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Slowly pour the milk and butter mixture into the well that you made in the dry ingredients without stirring. Then beat 1 egg and pour it into the middle of milk mixture.

steps.headline: Combine the ingredients in the bowl to make a shaggy dough.
steps.description: Use your hands or a wooden spoon to mix the dry ingredients with the milk mixture and egg. Keep mixing so you incorporate the dry bits of flour near the sides and bottom of the bowl. The dough should be very sticky at this point.

steps.headline: Knead the dough by hand for about 5 minutes.
steps.description: Sprinkle a little all-purpose flour on your work surface and put the sticky dough onto it. Use your hands to stretch and fold the dough repeatedly until the dough becomes smooth. If you prefer to knead the dough in a stand mixer, use a dough hook attachment and knead it on low speed for about 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Cover and prove the dough for 1 hour.
steps.description: Spread a little vegetable oil inside a large bowl so it's lightly coated. Set the dough into it and cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Leave the dough to rest until it doubles in volume.Tip: Put the dough in a warm part of your house to help it grow in volume. For example, put it in an oven that's turned off, but keep the oven light on.

steps.headline: Mix raisins, mixed peel, zest, apple, and cinnamon into the dough.
steps.description: Remove the plastic wrap from the bowl with the dough. Introduce 1/2 cup (75 g) of golden raisins, 2/3 cup (50 g) of mixed peel, the zest of 1 orange, 1 peeled, diced apple, and 1 teaspoon (2 g) of ground cinnamon into the dough. Keep the dough in the bowl so it's easier to mix the fruit into it. Use your hands to knead the fruit and spice into the dough so they're incorporated.

steps.headline: Prove the fruity dough for 1 hour.
steps.description: Lay plastic wrap over the bowl and set the dough aside until it doubles in volume. Since the dough now has a lot of fruit in it, it may take a little more than 1 hour.

steps.headline: Roll the dough into a long log and cut it into 15 pieces.
steps.description: Sprinkle a little more flour on your work surface and place the hot cross bun dough on it. Use your palms to roll the dough until it forms a log that's about 15 inches (38 cm) long. Then use a knife or bench cutter to divide the dough into 15 evenly sized pieces. Each piece of dough should weigh about 2.5 ounces (75 g). If you have a digital kitchen scale, use it to ensure each ball weighs the same.

steps.headline: Shape each piece of dough into a ball.
steps.description: Dust your hands with flour and roll a piece of dough between your palms to create a smooth ball. If it's easier to handle, roll the piece of dough on a lightly floured surface until it forms a ball.

steps.headline: Place the balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
steps.description: Lay a sheet of parchment on a baking sheet and put the balls of dough on the sheet. They should be about 1 in (2.5 cm) apart. If you prefer, use 2 baking sheets to prove and bake the buns.

steps.headline: Cover the buns and prove them for 1 hour.
steps.description: Spray a little cooking spray on a piece of plastic wrap and lay the greased side directly on the buns. Place the covered buns in a warm place to prove until they've doubled in size.Did You Know? Gently press your finger into a bun and remove it. If the bun has finished proving, the dough should spring back immediately.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 425 °F (218 °C) and move the oven racks.
steps.description: Adjust the racks so there's one in the middle of the oven. You may also need to remove the top rack if there's not much space between the middle and top racks. There should be at least 5 inches (13 cm) of space between the racks.

steps.headline: Mix all-purpose flour with water to make a white paste.
steps.description: Get out a small bowl and put 2/3 cup (75 g) of all-purpose flour into it. Stir 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of water into it at a time until the paste is smooth and thick. Add up to 5 tablespoons (74 ml) of water in order to make a paste you can pipe.Did You Know? Piping a plain white paste over the buns will create the classic cross on the buns.

steps.headline: Put the paste in a piping bag and pipe a cross on each bun.
steps.description: Scoop the paste into a piping bag that you've fitted with a small, plain tip. Squeeze a line of paste directly across the middle of each bun. Then turn the buns 90-degrees and pipe another line across each to create the crosses. If you don't have a piping bag, fill a sealable plastic bag with the paste. Trim off a small corner of the bag so you can squeeze the paste out.

steps.headline: Bake the hot cross buns for 20 minutes.
steps.description: Put the buns onto the middle rack in the preheated oven and bake them until the tops turn golden brown. The paste crosses should turn a rich yellow color and harden.

steps.headline: Remove the buns and microwave the apricot jam for 10 seconds.
steps.description: Set the sheet of buns on the stove and put 3 tablespoons (60 g) of apricot jam into a small microwave-safe bowl. Heat the jam until it melts. If you don't have apricot jam, substitute peach jam.

steps.headline: Strain the jam and brush it over the warm buns before serving.
steps.description: Set a small fine-mesh strainer over a bowl and push the warm jam through it. Any chunks or bits will be left in the sieve. Then dip a pastry brush into the strained jam and brush it over the buns. Serve the warm buns with plenty of butter. The warm buns will absorb some of the jam's sweetness and the jam will give the buns a nice shine. Hot cross buns will taste best the day they're made, but you can store them in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days.
